channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: BMP: Why release Jinggoy but keep other ECQ 'violators' in jail?
item.description: If police will allow other quarantine violators such as former Sen. Jinggoy Estrada walk free, then political prisoners and other lockdown violators should be released from detention, Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino said Monday.

item.title: COVID-19 recoveries in Philippines surge to 1,315 with biggest daily rise
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: More than 247,000 people have been killed and 3.5 million infection worldwide by the virus that originated in Wuhan, China in December last year.

item.title: Guevarra stands firm: Broadcast companies may operate pending franchise renewal
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “The DOJ stands by its position that there is sufficient equitable basis to allow broadcast entities to continue operating while the bills for the renewal of their franchise remain pending with Congress,” Guevarra told reporters.

item.title: 12 Senate staffers yield positive results in COVID-19 rapid testing
item.description: Senate President Vicente Sotto III said 12 out of 500 people who underwent rapid testing at the Senate were found to have antibodies that may be linked to the new coronavirus.

item.title: Press groups report 61 cases of attacks vs media since January 2019
item.description: A day after the commemoration of the World Press Freedom Day, the Freedom For Media, Freedom for All network said it had documented 61 incidents of attacks and threats against journalists between January 1, 2019 to April 30,2020.

item.title: Duterte orders to make OFW PhilHealth contributions voluntary
item.description: Overseas Filipino Workers are no longer mandated to pay premium contributions to the Philippine Health Insurance Corp.

item.title: UST stops hospital lay-offs as workers mull gov't mediation
item.description: USTH reportedly let go of around 40 of its workers due to financial losses as a result of the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: 3 Filipinos in Netherlands awarded royal honors for volunteer work
item.description: Koninklijke onderscheidingen (royal honors) are awarded annually with around 3,500 appointments to the Order of Orange-Nassau—one of the royal house orders that falls under the full jurisdiction of King Willem Alexander.

item.title: ABS-CBN legislative franchise expires May 4
item.description: There are at least 11 bills on the network’s franchise renewal pending before the House of Representatives’ legislative franchises.

item.title: LIVE updates: COVID-19 and extended quarantine in the Philippines
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: The latest updates on the spread of the novel coronavirus in the Philippines and enhanced community quarantine of economic center of Metro Manila and other areas across the country.
